com.poesys.accounting.dataloader.oldaccounting

Class OldDataBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.poesys.accounting.dataloader.oldaccounting.OldDataBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IBuilder

    public class OldDataBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
implements IBuilder
    Production implementation of the IBuilder interface that loads data from a designated path for a list of fiscal years.
    Author:
    Robert J. Muller

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  OldDataBuilder.AccountGroupStrategy
      The system groups accounts into categories (Cash, Credit Cards, and so on) that grouped accounts by number; each group had a range of accounts, always from nn0.00 to nn9.99, so groups had "ten" accounts (plus some number of sub-accounts).
      private class  OldDataBuilder.AccountMapStrategy
      The old accounting system was implemented separately for each fiscal year, allowing for changes to the account name and the changing of account numbers from year to year.
      private class  OldDataBuilder.AccountStrategy
      Accounts in the old system had unique account numbers with two parts separated by a decimal point, which represented the main account and sub-accounts.
      private class  OldDataBuilder.BalanceStrategy
      Balances get set in the first fiscal year processed, associating an initial balance with an account.
      private class  OldDataBuilder.CapitalEntityStrategy
      A capital entity is a named entity that owns some part of the capital of the accounting system.
      static interface  OldDataBuilder.IBuildStrategy
      Strategy pattern that allows the Builder to share the basic file-reading code, putting the construction-specific work into each strategy class.
      private class  OldDataBuilder.ItemIndex
      Map index object that indexes items by a combination of transaction id and account; used in item lookup maps for receivables
      private class  OldDataBuilder.ItemStrategy
      Transaction items associate with a transaction by id and an account by number, specifying the debit or credit amount by which the transaction changes the value of the account.These get cleared for each fiscal year.
      private class  OldDataBuilder.ReimbursementStrategy
      Reimbursements link reimbursing transactions to receivable transactions in the current or prior fiscal years.
      private class  OldDataBuilder.TransactionStrategy
      Transactions contain the set of transactions for each fiscal year.

      private static java.lang.String ACCOUNT_ERROR 
      private java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String> accountMap
      lookup map that translates account numbers to new-accounting account names; permits mapping of incoming accounts for the current fiscal year to existing accounts from prior fiscal years by name mapping

      private java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Map<OldDataBuilder.ItemIndex,Item>> receivablesMap
      the shared lookup map of fiscal year maps of receivable items indexed by year, then by the ItemIndex combination of transaction id and account (that is, Map(year, Map(itemIndex, item)); the buildFiscalYear() method initializes the nested map for the year
      private java.util.Set<Reimbursement> reimbursementDataSet 
      private java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Map<OldDataBuilder.ItemIndex,Item>> reimbursementsMap
      the shared lookup map of fiscal year maps of reimbursing items indexed by year, then by the ItemIndex combination of transaction id and account (that is, Map(year, Map(itemIndex, item)); the buildFiscalYear() method initializes the nested map for the year
      private java.util.Set<Transaction> transactionDataSet 
      private java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Transaction> transactionMap
      lookup map that translates an old transaction id into a new-accounting transaction object; this provides a way to map items to transactions; cleared by buildFiscalYear()

    • Constructor Detail

      • OldDataBuilder

        public OldDataBuilder(IParameters parameters)
        Create a OldDataBuilder object. The parameters object must contain a path to a directory containing one sub-directory for each fiscal year, no gaps allowed, and must provide a series of readers with the correct data characteristics. The fiscal year contains all the relevant data that the client can use to create the accounting system. Building a fiscal year clears all the data sets not shared between years, so the client must call all the process steps for a given fiscal year, then get the fiscal year object. Use the appropriate getters to get the shared data sets.
        Parameters:
        parameters - the program parameters object (path and file names)

    • Method Detail

      • buildCapitalStructure

        public void buildCapitalStructure()
        Description copied from interface: IBuilder
        Build the capital structure of the accounting system from input data. This is the initial step in the build process. It creates the capital entities for the accounting system.
        Specified by:
        buildCapitalStructure in interface IBuilder

      • buildFiscalYear

        public void buildFiscalYear(java.lang.Integer year)
        Description copied from interface: IBuilder
        Build a fiscal year object based on a specified integer year. This step clears any existing year-based data to provide a clean build for the specified year. It leaves the shared data structures passed through the constructor arguments, such as account groups, accounts, transactions, and receivable-account-item lookups.
        Specified by:
        buildFiscalYear in interface IBuilder
        Parameters:
        year - the year number

      • readFile

        public void readFile(java.io.Reader reader,
                     OldDataBuilder.IBuildStrategy strategy)
        Read a specified file into the corresponding data structures using the appropriate IBuildStrategy object. The file must have fewer than 5,000 rows of data, which prevents infinite loops. This method has public access to allow direct unit testing, as it is the critical section of code in the class.
        Specified by:
        readFile in interface IBuilder
        Parameters:
        reader - the input data reader
        strategy - the build strategy object

      • buildAccountGroups

        public void buildAccountGroups()
        Description copied from interface: IBuilder
        Build a set of account groups. This builds a list of account groups in the current fiscal year and orders them. Depends on buildFiscalYear().
        Specified by:
        buildAccountGroups in interface IBuilder

      • buildAccountMap

        public void buildAccountMap()
        Description copied from interface: IBuilder
        Build a map of new-accounting account names indexed by current-fiscal-year account number. This map provides a mapping for the current year's accounts identified by account number to the new-accounting accounts identified by name. It also permits mapping account-number changes from year to year for balance sheet accounts. Depends on buildFiscalYear().
        Specified by:
        buildAccountMap in interface IBuilder

      • buildAccounts

        public void buildAccounts()
        Description copied from interface: IBuilder
        Build the set of accounts from input data. Depends on buildAccountMap().
        Specified by:
        buildAccounts in interface IBuilder

      • buildBalances

        public void buildBalances()
        Description copied from interface: IBuilder
        Build the set of balance transactions from input data. Call this method only for the first fiscal year; the new accounting system maintains only the initial balances for the entity, not an annual balance. Depends on buildAccounts().
        Specified by:
        buildBalances in interface IBuilder

      • buildBalanceTransactions

        private void buildBalanceTransactions()
        Build the balance transactions and put them into the transaction set in the fiscal year. The method creates one balance transaction per account balance, with one item.

      • getAccountFromBalance

        private Account getAccountFromBalance(Balance balance)
        Given a specified balance, get the new accounting system account for the balance by looking up the balance account number in the account map created earlier in the build process.
        Parameters:
        balance - the balance for which to get the account
        Returns:
        the new accounting system account

      • buildTransactions

        public void buildTransactions()
        Description copied from interface: IBuilder
        Build the set of transactions and items from input data for the current fiscal year. The method updates the set of transactions with generated transactions as required by the parameterized updater. The method adds all the transactions to the accumulating set of transactions that spans fiscal years. The implementation should throw a RuntimeException if there is any invalid transaction. Depends on buildAccounts().
        Specified by:
        buildTransactions in interface IBuilder

      • readTransactionsAndItems

        private void readTransactionsAndItems()
        Read the transactions and items from the old-accounting data with the appropriate strategies. Items are children of transactions, so the loader needs to load both together.

      • createTransactions

        private void createTransactions()
        Iterate through the transaction data set and create all the new-accounting transactions, adding them to the transaction lookup map indexed by transaction id.

      • createItems

        private void createItems()
        Iterate through the old-accounting items. Look up the transaction in the transaction map. Look up the account in the account map. Add the item to the transaction, which creates the item and associates it to the transaction and account. Throw a runtime exception if the transaction id or the account number is not in the relevant lookup map. Index each receivable-account item either as a receivable (debit) or reimbursement (credit). The buildReimbursements process step that follows will use these lookups along with the reimbursements data set to create reimbursement links.

      • indexReceivableItem

        private void indexReceivableItem(java.lang.Integer id,
                                 java.lang.Float accountNumber,
                                 boolean debit,
                                 Item newItem)
        Put a receivable account item into the receivables (debit) or reimbursements (credit) map.
        Parameters:
        id - the transaction id for the item
        accountNumber - the account number for the item; must be a receivable account number
        debit - whether the item is debit (true) or credit (false)
        newItem - the new-accounting version of the item

      • validateTransactions

        private boolean validateTransactions()
        Validate all the transactions currently in the transaction lookup map. If there are invalid transactions, log them as errors. Log all the invalid transactions. If there is at least one invalid transaction, return false; otherwise, return true.
        Returns:
        false if there is at least one invalid transaction; otherwise, true

      • buildReimbursements

        public void buildReimbursements()
        Description copied from interface: IBuilder
        Build the reimbursement links between receivable items and reimbursing items. Depends on buildTransactions(), which creates all the items needed for linking (receivable and reimbursement items).
        Specified by:
        buildReimbursements in interface IBuilder

      • getBalanceReceivableId

        private java.lang.Integer getBalanceReceivableId(java.lang.Integer receivableYear,
                                                 java.lang.Float receivableAccountNumber)
        Get the balance id for a receivable account if the balance year is the same as the receivable year; otherwise, throw a runtime exception. Make sure the balance for the account is non-zero, and if it is zero, throw a runtime exception.
        Parameters:
        receivableYear - the designated receivable year of a reimbursement
        receivableAccountNumber - the old-accounting account number for the receivable account
        Returns:
        the transaction id for the balance transaction for the receivable account

      • getAccountFromNumber

        private Account getAccountFromNumber(java.lang.Integer year,
                                     java.lang.Float accountNumber)
        Get a new-accounting Account object from a fiscal year and account number. Note that the old-accounting account numbers are unique only within a fiscal year, so you need to know the fiscal year if there is an error.
        Parameters:
        year - the fiscal year (used in error message)
        accountNumber - the account number in the fiscal year
        Returns:
        the account

      • validateBalanceReceivable

        private void validateBalanceReceivable(java.lang.Integer receivableYear,
                                       java.lang.Float receivableAccountNumber,
                                       Transaction balanceTransaction,
                                       Item item)
        Validate a balance transaction:
        • Is the item amount non-zero? Balance must be positive.
        • Is the balance transaction non-null?
        • Is the year of the transaction the same as the receivable year?
        Parameters:
        receivableYear - the year of the receivable in the reimbursement
        receivableAccountNumber - the receivable account (for error report)
        balanceTransaction - the balance transaction to check
        item - the balance item to check

      • lookupReceivableItem

        private Item lookupReceivableItem(java.lang.Integer year,
                                  java.lang.Integer id,
                                  java.lang.Float accountNumber)
        Look up a receivable item in the receivables map.
        Parameters:
        year - the fiscal year of the item
        id - the transaction id of the item
        accountNumber - the account number of the item
        Returns:
        the receivable item

      • lookupReimbursingItem

        private Item lookupReimbursingItem(java.lang.Integer year,
                                   java.lang.Integer id,
                                   java.lang.Float accountNumber)
        Look up a reimbursing item in the reimbursements map.
        Parameters:
        year - the fiscal year of the item
        id - the transaction id of the item
        accountNumber - the account number of the item
        Returns:
        the reimbursing item

        public FiscalYear getFiscalYear()
